page.title: 09THE COURT LEET OFFICIALS
page.content: {FISH AND FLESH TASTERS.}There are two of these.They inspected the quality of the meat and fish.{ {AFFEARORS.}Two men again who collected taxes for the Lord of the Manor. {ALETASTERS.}Two men who still go round and test the ale to see if it is fit to drink. {BREADWEIGHER.}Two men who still go round and check weight of bread.In the middle ages bakers who sold short weight would be put in the stocks. {BROOKLOOKERS.}Checked all riverways. {SEALER AND SEARCHER OF LEATHER.}Two men who checked quality of leather. {SURVEYOR OF HIGHWAY.}Checked roadways. {CONSTABLE.}Maintained law and order. {TOWN CRIER.}Used for ceremonial purposes. These men, together with the{Baliff, } perform all ceremonial duties in the town of Alcester.
